summary: Make some of the quest items droppable so you can put them on shelves/displays/inside containers.
descriptionHtml:
[color=#00ff00][u][b][size=3]SHORT DESCRIPTION:[/size][/b][/u][/color]
[size=3]This mod simply gives you ability to make some quest items droppable, so you can get rid of them from your inventory. [/size]

[color=#00ff00][size=3][u][b]DETAILED DESCRIPTION:[/b][/u][/size][/color]
After installing the mod, you will get "Convert Quest Item" power. It will allow you to transform some quest items which can be found while exploring caves and ruins (such as Meridia's Beacon, Unusual Gems, and many others). You can, then, put them on a shelf/display/table/inside container or just sell them to a collector. At that moment they stop being quest items and you can't use them to proceed with the quests. To make them quest items again, simply use "Convert Quest Item" power again to return them to original form. All converted items have exclamation marks in the names, so you can distinguish them from original items.

Collectors who are willing to buy your quest items can be found in Whiterun and Riften.

[color=#ff0000][u][b][size=5]!!!WARNING!!![/size][/b][/u][/color]
[size=3]Selling quest items is not recommended, unless you know you don't want to finish certain quests and you know exactly what you are doing[/size].[size=3] Consider yourself warned. [/size]

[u][size=3][b]LIST OF INCLUDED QUEST ITEMS:[/b][/size][/u]
Gauldur Amulet Fragments
Black Books (non-sellable)
Elder Scrolls (non-sellable)
King Olaf's Verse
Ivory Dragon Claw
Ruby Dragon Claw
Glowing Crystal Shards
Curious Silver Mold
Meridia's Beacon
Mehrunes' Razor Parts
Statue of Dibella (from Markarth)
Tolfdir's Alembic
Unusual Gems
Kahvozein's Fang
Red Eagle's Fury

[b]FOR SELLABLE VERSION[/b][u]
[/u]Tolfdir's Alembic and Statue of Dibella can be sold to general merchants, because they are not so special, the rest can only be sold to a collector (except Black Books and Elder Scrolls - they are not for sale at all).

Let me know if you know any other items that should be made droppable.

[color=#00ff00][u][b][size=3]REQUIREMENTS:[/size][/b][/u][/color]
Skyrim.esm
Dawnguard.esp
Dragonborn.esp
[color=#00ff00][b][u][size=3]
INSTALLATION:[/size][/u][/b][/color]
Put in your Data folder and activate. It is recommended to start a new game, because if you already have some quest items in your inventory, you won't be able to convert them into droppable versions. In that case you will need to use console command to remove them from inventory and add them again. But if you don't have any items from the list above, it should be fine installing the mod mid-game.
[color=#00ff00][size=3][b][u]
COMPATIBILITY:[/u][/b][/size][/color]
Should be compatible with any mod.

[color=#ff0000]Version 1.0.2:[/color]
- Elder Scrolls added
